definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
The Voice of China, PRC reality talent show

sentences.english: The pity of it is that an intelligent man appears to have been seduced by the sound of his own voice.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这位智者似乎被自己的声音误导了。

sentences.english: Elisa started at the sound of her husband's voice.
sentences.chinese: 听到丈夫的声音，伊利莎吃了一惊。

sentences.english: I commanded the voice before terror could incapacitate me.
sentences.chinese: 我赶在恐惧击倒我以前对那个声音下令。

sentences.english: Simulations have been made to validate the good separation performance of the algor…
sentences.chinese: 仿真验证对声音等非平稳信号具有良好的分离效果。

sentences.english: Don't make any noise while the baby is sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 孩子睡觉时别发出任何声音。

sentences.english: Exam, only write the pen of the broken broken voice and more or less beating.
sentences.chinese: 考试中，只有写字笔的碎碎声音和或多或少的心跳声。

sentences.english: There are two different sound alerts , which can be set to On or OFF.
sentences.chinese: 有两种不同的声音警报，其中可以设置为开或关。

sentences.english: The voice of the mournful chanter called to dolorous prayer.
sentences.chinese: 哀恸的领唱人的声音向哀伤的祷告者呼唤。

sentences.english: The whales expired with a rushing sound.
sentences.chinese: 那些鲸鱼呼气时发出一种急促的声音。

sentences.english: Direct the DSAS's microphone towards the source of sound.
sentences.chinese: 指令员的麦克风对源头的声音。

sentences.english: Whoever flees at the sound of terror will fall into a pit;
sentences.chinese: 躲避恐惧声音的必坠入陷坑。

sentences.english: "I want to hear their voices, " she said. "I hope you're safe.
sentences.chinese: “我想听到他们的声音”，她说，“我希望你们平安。

sentences.english: Loud, persistent ringing in the ears, known as tinnitus, can be vexing for its millions of sufferers.
sentences.chinese: 耳朵里持续嘈杂的声音使众多耳鸣患者烦恼不堪。

sentences.english: Only humming a little, the quiet sound in the head.
sentences.chinese: 哼哼小曲，脑子里有一个轻微的声音。

definition: (of a sound) to come through/to be heard/(of news) to arrive
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
pitch of voice (high or low)/pitch (of a musical note)/tone
